meanings.definition: Capable of assimilating or absorbing information or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The assimilative student quickly understood the new lesson.
meanings.sent2: She has an assimilative mind that grasps concepts easily.
meanings.sent3: The assimilative student absorbed knowledge like a sponge.
meanings.sent4: Her assimilative abilities made her a quick learner.
meanings.sent5: His assimilative nature allowed him to excel in school.

meanings.definition: Tending to assimilate or cause assimilation.
meanings.sent1: The assimilative culture embraced diversity and inclusion.
meanings.sent2: The assimilative behavior of the group promoted unity.
meanings.sent3: Their assimilative approach to teamwork made everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent4: The assimilative atmosphere encouraged collaboration among team members.
meanings.sent5: The assimilative attitude of the team fostered a sense of belonging.

meanings.definition: Able to adapt or adjust to a new environment or culture.
meanings.sent1: The assimilative individual quickly acclimated to the foreign customs.
meanings.sent2: She is an assimilative traveler who easily blends in wherever she goes.
meanings.sent3: His assimilative skills in adapting to new cultures amazed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The assimilative nature of the community made it easy for newcomers to fit in.
meanings.sent5: Her assimilative abilities allowed her to thrive in diverse settings.
